subsection.name: what-are-agents
subsection.title: What Are Claude Code Agents?
subsection.technical-explanation: Agents (also called subagents) are specialized AI assistants that operate with their own context windows, system prompts, and tool permissions, allowing for task-specific optimization and separation of concerns in complex workflows.
subsection.simple-breakdown: Think of agents like having different specialists on your team - one expert handles code reviews, another manages documentation, and another focuses on testing. Each one knows exactly what they're good at and has the right tools for their job.

agent-characteristics.characteristic: Custom system prompts tailored to specific tasks
Specific tool permissions for security and focus
Separate context windows for specialized processing

step.title: Create the Agent File
step.description: Set up the directory structure and create your agent file
step.technical-note: The .claude/agents/ directory is the standard location for agent definitions, and the .md extension allows for rich configuration documentation.
step.simple-note: Like creating a job description file - you're making a folder for your specialists and creating their first job description document.

step.title: Add the Agent Configuration
step.description: Copy this template into your agent file for a code review specialist
step.agent-template:
--- name: code-reviewer description: Expert code review specialist. Use PROACTIVELY after writing or modifying code. tools: Read, Grep, Glob, Edit model: sonnet color: Cyan ---
You are a senior code reviewer ensuring high standards of code quality.
Your responsibilities: 1. Review code for bugs, security issues, and performance problems 2. Check for proper error handling and edge cases 3. Verify code follows project conventions 4. Suggest improvements for readability and maintainability
Always provide: - Specific line-by-line feedback - Security vulnerability assessment - Performance optimization suggestions - Code quality score (1-10)
When reviewing code: - Focus on correctness and security first - Consider maintainability and readability - Suggest specific improvements with examples - Explain WHY changes are needed - Be constructive and educational in feedback

configuration-explanation.field: When and how to use this agent
Specific Claude Code tools the agent can access
AI model to use (sonnet, opus, haiku)
Visual identifier in Claude Code interface

step.title: Test Your Agent
step.description: Deploy and test your new agent with sample code
step.testing-commands:
# Save some test code to review echo "def add(a, b): return a + b" > test_code.py
# Use your agent to review it claude @code-reviewer "Please review the code in test_code.py"
step.expected-behavior: Your agent should provide detailed feedback about the simple function, suggesting improvements like type hints, docstrings, input validation, and error handling - demonstrating its specialized focus on code quality.

agent-example.configuration: name: doc-specialist description: Documentation expert. Use when creating or updating docs. tools: Read, Edit, Write, Glob model: sonnet color: Green

practice.name: specialized-focus
practice.title: Keep Agents Specialized
practice.technical-advice: Each agent should handle one primary responsibility to maintain context focus and expertise depth
practice.simple-advice: Like having different doctors for different problems - don't make one agent try to do everything

practice.name: clear-descriptions
practice.title: Write Clear Descriptions
practice.technical-advice: Agent descriptions should specify when to use them proactively, helping build effective workflows
practice.simple-advice: Write job descriptions that make it obvious when to call each specialist

practice.name: appropriate-tools
practice.title: Limit Tool Access
practice.technical-advice: Only grant tools necessary for the agent's function to maintain security and focus
practice.simple-advice: Don't give everyone the master key - only give tools that each specialist actually needs

models.model: Fast, simple tasks like formatting or basic analysis
Balanced tasks like code review or documentation
Complex tasks requiring deep reasoning or creativity

issue.name: agent-not-found
issue.solution: Check file is in .claude/agents/ and name matches configuration

issue.name: permission-errors
issue.solution: Add required tools to the agent's tools list in configuration

issue.name: poor-responses
issue.solution: Refine the system prompt to be more specific about responsibilities and output format
